oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Man-made pond
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pond constructed in the spring of 1959 under Soil Bank program. Pit-type pond 150 feet square and 6 feet deep, with 4:1 side slopes. Pond is constructed on Dickson soil. Located eight miles south of Woodbury.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
H.J. Young, conservation aid, on far bank
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm ponds; Soil Bank Conservation Reserve Program (U.S.)
Photographic prints;
